This Week’s Best EDM, Featuring Rustie, Sweater Beats, and Tiga

posted by khal on October 25, 2014 in Audio

Image via deviantart.com

Heading directly into fall, and the fresh beats just aren’t slowing down. There are a number of surprising electronic gems on the horizon, showcasing how well the electronic music scene performs in Q4 (compared to other scenes). Don’t believe me, just watch listen.

Tiga ft. Pusha T – “Bugatti”

I wasn’t sure how this would come out when I first heard it; I’m not sure how people are taking it. I’m resigned to say that it’s just too future.

Rustie ft. Redinho – “Lost (VIP)”

Rustie channeled a grip of energy into this Redinho-featured Green Language single.

BANKS – “Drowning (Stwo Remix)”

Stwo needs to remix every Banks tune.

Jerome LOL ft. Sara Z – “All That I Am”

Jerome goes into a silky smooth house lane on this 5oFoF compilation standout.

Maya Jane Coles x GAPS – “In Dark, In Day”

MJC x GAPS FTW.

Emalkay & Caspa – “Tomorrow”

These two have been pushing the dubstep envelope for years, and seeing them link back up for a collaboration in 2014 is just what the (dub)doctor ordered.

Paula Temple – “DEATHVOX”

The title track from Paula’s forthcoming EP on R&S is all kinds of tribal squelches. Pure intensity.

The Invaderz – “Jazz Club”

Perfect fall season drum & bass, taken from The Invaderz forthcoming Commercial Suicide LP, New Found Dialect.

Feed Me & Kill The Noise – “Far Away”

Beats so uplifting, the only vocals it needed were from a chorus of UK schoolchildren.

Starkey ft. D Double E – “Screwed On”

Starkey and D Double: a match made in grime heaven.

little cloud – “you”

Hemsworth sure knows how to pick ‘em. This beautiful number from Sweden’s little cloud is the latest on Secret Songs.

Sweater Beats’ Cloud City EP

Sweater Beats’ latest EP drops next week, and we (well, I) have a feeling it’ll be up there with the best EPs of 2014.

Tags:  EDM, jerome lol, little cloud, pusha t, rustie, Starkey, stwo, sweater beats, Tiga

OLDMen Among Boys – “Rivers” NEWClarens – “Pray”
